page.title: 18EDUCATION IN WALSALL
page.content: Education can begin at three years of age though this is not compulsory. To cater for this there are 11 public Nursery Schools and a similar number of private ones, as well as units in other Primary Schools. In the Primary sector there are 38 Junior and Infant, 23 Junior and 27 Infant schools. In addition there are 14 Voluntary Aided and 11 Voluntary Controlled Primary Schools. There are 17 Comprehensive Schools, 3 Voluntary Aided Comprehensive and 2 Voluntary Aided, single-sex, High Schools. Remedial education is provided for those children requiring it in 10 purpose-built Special schools. Tertiary education is facilitated by the Walsall Colleges of Technology, Art and Higher Education, which are individual institutions.
